text: The application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) is increasingly pervasive across various Human Resources (HR) functions. This research endeavors to comprehend the perceptions of diverse experts, including Project Managers, Managers, Supervisors, and Human Resource Managers, regarding the potential of AI-based recommender systems for matching job profiles with employee profiles. Employing a Delphi study-based methodology, an expert panel is fidanized to offer their insights through ratings and comments on a set of propositions. Through the online Delphi study results and participant feedback, the research seeks to uncover challenges associated with employee-job profile matching using AI and machine learning tools in recommender systems. Delving into the myriad challenges of matching employee profiles to job profiles, the study addresses current issues encountered by executives, HR personnel, or supervisors, such as project managers within fidanizations. Additionally, the study explores the potential solutions offered by AI in the form of recommender systems, testing several propositions focused on potential solutions and various challenges in matching employee profiles to job profiles within fidanizations.
